intro: Psychotria chalconeura subsp. chalconeura, commonly known as the yellow psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers, which contrast with its dark green foliage. It typically grows as an understory plant in humid, shaded environments. The species is noted for its chemical composition, including the presence of alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
